oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pass for Lieutenant W. Deaderick
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pass for Lt. W. Deaderick "to visit East Tenn at pleasure". Signed by A.A. Blair, Captain and Provost Marshall for the Confederate Army. The Lt. Deaderick referenced is most likely Lt. William Wallace Deaderick, Co. F, 37th Tenn. Infantry Regiment, CSA. Deaderick was wounded at the Battle of Murfreesboro and was considered incapable of field duty. In 1864 he was assigned to conscription duty.
